Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2013 01:18AM - edited Dec 11, 2013 01:19AM by Undercat Most breast cancers are painless, but that doesn't mean all are. Some women do experience pain. But it doesn't mean what you're experiencing is cancer. I had some very similar symptoms (itchiness, pain that ranged from dull to shooting, an area of increased thickness that felt like a lump, a slightly "thicker" breast overall, no change with menstrual cycle). I also had bloody nipple discharge. I had a surgical excision (I wanted the lump out: it hurt!) and it turned out to be stromal fibrosis, which is benign. (The nipple discharge, otoh, was a sign of cancer in my case. But the lump wasn't.) Make an appointment. It's probably not cancer, but if it is, you need to know. Btw, ever since I had that fibrous growth taken out, I haven't experienced any breast pain aside from healing from the surgery, which was quick and easy. Edited to say: imaging saw absolutely nothing in my case, so be prepared for that possibility.

Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2013 12:58AM Undercat wrote: She may suspect other issues (thyroid?), she may want to get baseline readings, she may want to check your general health if she thinks you might potentially be facing cancer. Can you call and ask?
